content:
Trying to rethink the "People to add" section of our stream creation flow, since it is a mess.
What would folks think of just an input box, where you could enter in streams or users with a combined typeahead?

E.g. something like the last input box of
pasted image
Are you proposing to eliminate the feature of copy-subscribers-from-stream?
And will there be a way to see who you've subscribed so far?
(High level, I'm highly in favor of the textbox approach over the current way, but there are definitely some real-world factors when creating new streams that we should accommodate.)
In the UI from that screenshot, I'm imagining that as you select people, they populate a list underneath that box.
(That might even be how the pictured UI actually works, which would explain why I'm imagining it that way. :stuck_out_tongue: )

proposing to eliminate the copy-subs-from-stream

yes, in a way, though that functionality will be available by adding #stream in the textbox
the pictured UI (from slack) does not allow adding channels
pasted image

way to see who you've subscribed

that would be a thing that is lost, though honestly it is pretty painful to see it in our current UI.

If I'm adding 10 people to a stream, and I'm kind of doing it from memory or looking around the room, I think it's useful to see the people I've added so far. (The painful part of our current UI is that you see the 990 people you haven't added.)

oh yeah, I'm imagining pills for the streams and people you add, similar to the picture in the 11:08 message.
The thing that is lost is being able to add a small stream, and see right there who exactly was added.

(along with wonderful features like being able to add the set difference of streams, including by accident)
set difference of streams was probably usually by accident, but stream minus a few people (intentionally) was probably a bit more common
yeah, I wonder if that is a used-enough feature that we would want to add syntax for it (like -@... excludes a person)
I'd start without that feature, I think
@Greg Price It would be a regression, so we want to be a bit careful about this.
Another option is that when you select a stream, just put the pills for all the stream users into the textbox. (or have a way to "explode" a pill into individual users)

My intuition is that it is at most it a lightly used feature. Even when that was explicitly my goal (create a copy of a stream minus someone), the current UI for doing it doesn't make it clear that that is going to happen, so I end up adding people by hand.

Yeah, but our realm is huge...for a ~50 person realm, I think the mechanism would have been a bit more clear. I'm fine with regressing this, but we should be prepared to scramble a bit if we release this and folks complain.
Is this something we can ask Sonalia about (or somebody at RC)?
I think adding in the - syntax will be pretty easy if this actually becomes a problem
and will be an improvement over the current UI for it anyway
